Israel moves toward Netanyahu-led October 7 inquiry as Qatar scandal deepens
subhead: The Knesset passed a bill in its first reading to establish a special commission of inquiry into the failures of October 7, in line with the wishes of Benjamin Netanyahu, who has rejected the idea of a more independent body. However, he now faces difficulties over his advisers' ties to Qatar.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to new ceasefire after weeks of deadly border fighting
subhead: The truce halts all military action along the disputed frontier after nearly a month of clashes that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than one million civilians.

title: Côte d'Ivoire's divided opposition fights for survival in legislative elections
subhead: Weakened by a campaign of repression and internal divisions, these political parties hope to prevent President Alassane Ouattara's party from securing an absolute majority in Parliament on Saturday, December 27.

title: Dining at Pierre Soulages' table
subhead: 'A Meal at the Museum' (1/6). In the southern region of Aveyron, Christophe Chaillou, the chef of Café Bras adjoining the Musée Soulages, prepares fresh, local cuisine shaped by market offerings.

title: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhead: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.
